main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted over West Springfield, Massachusetts, on 6 December 1950, resembling a silvery maneuvering device.
interesting points: The object was reported to have a silvery outline and a half-moon appearance., The sighting lasted less than 45 seconds., The observer estimated the object's altitude at 10,000 to 20,000 feet., Witnesses indicated a continuous whirling sound resembling jet propulsion., The Westover Approach Control Radar was inoperative at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: Unidentified flying object with silvery outline and half-moon shape
witness description: The observer is a service man for Remington Rand and a member of the Air National Guard with experience as an aircraft mechanic.
